intro: Sterculia aberrans, commonly known as the African tamarind tree, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The tree produces woody pods containing edible seeds, which are used in traditional medicine and as a food source. Its bark and leaves are also utilized in local remedies for their medicinal properties. The plant is well adapted to dry conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
